ml.codeboy.engine

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.codeboy.engine.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CreeperSweeper, Shooter, TitleScreen

    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener
    represents a Game there can only be one instance of this at the time

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetFPS

        public void setTargetFPS(int targetFPS)
        sets the target FPS of this Game - I do not recommend using this as it can only decrease your FPS - by default the FPS are not limited
        Parameters:
        targetFPS - the new targetFPS

        public long getSecondsRun()

      • getScheduler

        public TaskScheduler getScheduler()
        Returns:
        gets the TaskScheduler of this Game. The TaskScheduler can be used to schedule Tasks which will be run at a specified interval or once a certain time. For more information see TaskScheduler.scheduleTask(java.lang.Runnable, double, double)

      • initialise

        @Deprecated
protected void initialise()
        Deprecated. might get removed because you can use your Game´s constructor for initialisation
        will get called when the Game is initialised right before the gameLoop gets started (before the first game tick) override this on your Game to do initialisation

      • displayStats

        protected void displayStats(java.lang.String[] toDisplay)
        Parameters:
        toDisplay - a String array with information to be displayed on the top left of the screen override this and call super#displayStats to change the displayed stats even if you don´t have stats to display you should definitely override this

        public double getDeltaTime()
        Returns:
        the time in seconds that passed since the last frame

      • getDeltaTime

        public double getDeltaTime(boolean ignorePaused)
        Parameters:
        ignorePaused - if paused should be ignored for the return value - this can be useful if you want to only pause GameObjects but not UI animations
        Returns:
        the current deltaTime or #getDeltaTime
